event.title: Canadian Investment and Financing Workshop - International Trade - Episode Two

body.p: To continue with our series of "Canadian Investment and Financing Workshop", Canada China Capital Market Access presents to you: a seminar on International Trade - Episode Two

Uncertainty is evident during the operation of international trade business, from the risk of not being able to collect foreign accounts receivables to the fluctuation of different currencies, both at times could impact financial bottom line. How do we find ways to better manage these risks and normalize revenue and net income? Are there any cost-worthy insurance we could purchase and how can my bank offer me ways to hedge foreign exchange risk.
For this workshop, we have invited the following seasoned key note speakers:

Mr. Kevin Sullivan, Account Manager and trade advisor, Export Development Canada
Mr. Sullivan has had extensive experience in international trade prior to EDC, working in China and Germany with multi-national firms. Mr. Sullivan speaks fluent Chinese.

Ms. Tina Yu, VP Foreign Exchange Products, Bank of Montreal
Ms. Yu has over 20 years in BMO Capital market FX team. She represented BMO by providing monthly economic news review on Channel 14 â€“ Omni TV.
This workshop will focus on the following:

1) What are the different types of Accounts Receivables insurance and how do I use them effectively in my trading business?
2) How can Accounts Receivables insurance help me in bank financing?
3) How could FX risk impact my business?
4) What are the capital market products available to manage currency risk?
